perturbation.original_text: (a) HCI shall pay MLX a guaranteed fixed sum of [*] US per annum during the      Initial Term of this Agreement to be paid out as a monthly payment of [*]      US (the "Monthly Payment"). This Monthly Payment shall be due by the 10th      day of each month;
perturbation.changed_text: (a) HCI shall pay MLX a guaranteed fixed sum of [*] US per annum during the Initial Term of this Agreement to be paid out as a monthly payment of [*] US (the "Monthly Payment"). This Monthly Payment shall be due by the 30th day of the subsequent month;
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that monthly payments are due by the 10th of each month. The modified text changes the due date to the 30th of the subsequent month. This introduces potential inconsistencies with prompt payment laws, which often require payment within a specific timeframe. Delaying the payment to the 30th of the following month could violate these laws, leading to legal disputes and penalties.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Prompt Payment Laws (e.g., California Prompt Payment Act for private works)

perturbation.original_text: (c)  Both Parties shall keep true and accurate books and records of all revenue      generated as a result of the Co-Branded Site. Either Party shall have the      right from time to time to audit and make extracts of the books and records      of the other, insofar as said books or records pertain to the terms of this      Agreement. Any such audit shall take place upon not less than seven (7)      days advance written notice, during normal business hours of normal      business days and at reasonable intervals. Any such audit shall be at the
perturbation.changed_text: (c) Both Parties shall keep true and accurate books and records of all revenue generated as a result of the Co-Branded Site. Either Party shall have the right from time to time to audit and make extracts of the books and records of the other, insofar as said books or records pertain to the terms of this Agreement. Any such audit shall take place upon not less than two (2) days advance written notice, during normal business hours of normal business days and at reasonable intervals. Any such audit shall be at the
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the advance written notice for audits from seven days to two days may be considered unreasonably short, especially for complex financial audits. This could be seen as a violation of good faith and fair dealing, as it doesn't allow sufficient time for the other party to prepare for the audit. The change can be seen as legally contradictory as it imposes an unreasonable burden and violates standard business practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing

perturbation.original_text: During the Term of this Agreement and for a period of six (6) months thereafter, MediaLinx shall not use or publicly disclose the data collected from users of the Co-Branded Site if such use is for the purpose of providing health information, advertisements, or products that compete with those that reside on the Co-Branded Site. In other instances, MediaLinx shall be entitled to use or publicly disclose the data collected subject to privacy guidelines noted above.
perturbation.changed_text: During the Term of this Agreement and for a period of three (3) months thereafter, MediaLinx shall not use or publicly disclose the data collected from users of the Co-Branded Site if such use is for the purpose of providing health information, advertisements, or products that compete with those that reside on the Co-Branded Site. In other instances, MediaLinx shall be entitled to use or publicly disclose the data collected subject to privacy guidelines noted above.
perturbation.explanation: The original text prohibits MediaLinx from using user data for competitive purposes for six months after the agreement ends. Reducing this period to three months could violate consumer protection laws or privacy regulations that require a more extended period of data protection. This change could lead to legal issues related to unfair competition or misuse of personal data, conflicting with regulations designed to protect consumer privacy and data security.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Protection Laws and Privacy Regulations (e.g., CalOPPA, GDPR)
